Authors:
Milan C. Samarakoon, ITTHAYAKORN PROMPUTTHA, Jian-Kui
Liu
Title:
Dendrostoma covidicola sp. nov. (Erythrogloeaceae,
Diaporthales) on Fagus sylvatica from Sichuan Province, China
Keywords:
1 new species  Diaporthales  Multi-gene  Phylogeny 
Taxonomy
Abstract:
Dendrostoma covidicola sp. nov. is described from a dead
branch of Fagus sylvatica (Fagaceae) collected from Sichuan Province,
China. The taxon has 540 ostioles per pseudostroma and small,
ellipsoidal to subfusiform ascospores with polar appendages.
Phylogenetic analyses of a combined ITSLSUrpb2tef1 sequence matrix
confirmed its placement in Dendrostoma where it is close to D.
qinlingense, D. osmanthi and D. quercus (species described from Quercus
sp. in China), but representing a distinct linage. The new taxon is
compared with other Dendrostoma species and comprehensive descriptions
and illustrations are provided. An ascospore comparison for relevant
species is also provided, as well as an updated phylogenetic tree
(ITSLSUrpb2tef1) including all the species of Dendrostoma.
